data.title: "Go to symbol..." does not work in JS IIFE
Investigate to reduce working files watcher to only the ones opened
[html] Add option to configure formatter
data.body: It would be great if the auto-formatters could be configured. I am happy with most settings but some settings keep me from using it (in my case: "long" lines in HTML are automatically converted to multiple lines even though they should be kept intact).

data.title: Open file command ignores exclude filters

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: When opening a file `Ctrl+E` command the suggestions show files that are explicitly excluded by the settings. I tried both `files.exclude` and `search.exclude` but I still get the wrong hits.

data.title: crashes a lot with too many (>=20) files opened in working files
data.body: running on OS X Yosemite 10.10.5

data.title: Markdown styles: Can't use style sheet that contains "#" in the local path
data.body:
Can't use style sheet that contains "#" in the local path.

OK

```
{
    "markdown.styles": ["file://C:/CSharp/user.css"]
}
```

NG (net::ERR_FILE_NOT_FOUND)

```
{
    "markdown.styles": ["file://C:/C#/user.css"]
}
```

OK

```
{
    "markdown.styles": ["file://C:/C%23/user.css"]
}
```

Is this by design or a bug?

---

Version 0.10.8
Commit db71ac615ddf9f33b133ff2536f5d33a77d4774e
Date 2016-02-05T10:10:11.194Z
Shell 0.35.6
Renderer 45.0.2454.85
Node 4.1.1
WIndows 7

data.title: Allow file name to language associations via settings
data.body:
i have yaml in .controller, .asset etc files

```
%YAML 1.1
%TAG !u! tag:unity3d.com,2011:
```

when i open the file it does not detect it is yaml and sets it to plain text mode?
i can choose yaml from the language mode selector (to get nice coloring) but then i get an error on that first yaml 1.1 line

Expected a JSON object, array or literal
![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/962340/13452325/c4833196-e014-11e5-952a-cbdbe6b6cb97.png)
1. should it auto detect? or is there a way to associate files with languages? (no, see link below)
2. how to fix error?

thanks

https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/overview
Q: Can I map additional file extensions to a language?
A: Currently this is not supported but it's on the way.

data.title: Rename the product to "Visual Code", dropping "Studio" from name
data.body: Vscode is a totally different product from the Visual Studio behemoth. So IMHO, dropping **Studio** and renaming the product **Visual Code** will match the characteristic of this product better. This is not an IDE and thus not a Studio. And Visual Code suits to be name of a tool to visualize code. "Visual" will also goes with other development products from Microsoft like "Visual C++" or "Visual Basic". The twitter handle is already just @code. After the renaming, often used shorthand vscode can denote **V**i**s**ual **Code** instead of **V**isual **S**tudio **Code**. Even the product name in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/product.json do not have the word "Studio". So, everything will fit together.

data.title: Infinite loop sending output to an output channel from an extension makes VS Code stop responding
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14098140/13449180/cd9f6bf0-dfdd-11e5-9863-14a53677fa33.png)

Previous statement was wrong:
Constantly sending output to an output channel (as in an infinite loop printing data) from an extension makes VS Code stop responding. 
This happened both with the stable and alpha release.

data.title: launch.json "program" need '/'
data.body:
When automatically generate a launch.json, "program": "${workspaceRoot}index.js"
It should be "program": "${workspaceRoot}/index.js"

data.title: TextDocument#save resolves with false
data.body: According to [the TextDocument documentation](http://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/vscode-api#TextDocument), the `save()` method returns a promise that should resolve to `true` when the file has been saved. Unfortunately, I have a promise that is resolving to `false`, which I presume means the file was not saved, but there is no indication as to why. Also, if there was an error, why didn't the `onRejected` callback get called with the error instance instead of the `onFulfilled` callback with a simple `false` value?

data.title: Cursor problems in high contrast theme
data.body:
The line cursor becomes thinner in the high contrast theme.
A line cursor disappears when next to a bracket character, obscured by the box rendered around the bracket.
Flashing block cursor is not very readable because it doesn't have a good inverse-video algorithm, so the underlying character becomes unreadable half the time.

data.title: Change Indentation Size is not enabled in the current context.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The Change Indentation Size command is disabled from the Command Palette after first change.
1. Open VS Code.
2. Open a file with indentation (spaces).
3. F1 | Change Indentation Spaces
4. Select Tab Width (say 6)
5. Try again: F1 | Change Indentation Spaces
Get Info message that Command `Change Indentation Size` is not enabled in the current context.
Try close, reopening the current file, opening another file, the command still can't be enabled.
Change Indentation Size is available if you launch the command from the Spaces/Tabs: on the Status Bar.

data.body:
Smoke vscode test on the following distributions
- [x] ~~RHEL6~~ (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1056): Does not work without compiling from source (of which there are other problems).
- [x] RHEL7: Works
- [x] CentOS 7: Works
- [x] Fedora 23: Works

data.title: [folding] [lua] Weird code folding with Lua

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
A minor observation about an otherwise great feature! Using the Insiders build, the following Lua code causes weird folding:

```
function someFunc()

    local longString = [[this is a long
string that spans multiple lines
and has some weird folding]]

    print longString
end
```

You'll notice that a + shows up on the same "function someFunc()" line _and_ on the last line of the longString declaration. The first + folds up to the declaration line and the second + folds the rest of the function.

data.title: Autocompletion box "Loading..." indefinitely, even when receiving data
data.body:
I'm using **VS Code 0.10.9** on **OS X 10.11.3** with [Code-D](https://github.com/Pure-D/code-d) for writing code in **D**. 

I have all the dependencies that **Code-D** requests, and I can see that the plugin is properly initiated, but I can't get the **autocompletion** (intellisense) box to show. I have a .gif to describe  the problem:

![vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5645089/13436536/04f77988-dfe0-11e5-932b-7b131df71753.gif)

When I open Developer's Tools, I can see that the symbols are resolved properly, there is a list of objects I should be able to see in the autocompletion box, but it just hangs with "Loading..." message. Sometimes it hangs indefinitely, sometimes I get it to show literally after 1 minute. I also have to press _CTRL+Space_ after **"."**, it's not triggered automatically.

I have to pinpoint that this issue is known for this plugin, but only on OSX. Couple of people reported it, but there's nothing obvious wrong with the plugin. Just asking for clues if this is indeed a plugin problem, or somewhere below in VS Code and OSX.

Any help appreciated.

data.title: Vim Style Key binding
data.body: There are a few extensions in the [marketplace](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/search?term=vim&target=VSCode&sortBy=Relevance) for Vim, however Vim key bindings is still such a hot request in [User Voice](https://visualstudio.uservoice.com/forums/293070-visual-studio-code/suggestions/7752447-vim-style-keybindings). Can VS Code / Vim users chime in on what is currently missing?

data.title: Emmet not working in vanilla VSCode install (0.10.x)
data.body:
Not sure what's going on here, I removed and re-installed VSCode just to be sure. Emmet does not seem to be working:
1. Open HTML file with the contents:

``` html
<html>
<body>
</body>
</html>
```

_(editor shows HTML in bottom right info-bar)_
1. Between the body tags, I enter:
   `div>ul>li*5`
2. Hit enter and nothing happens, just go to new line. In fact, no auto HTML formatting is happening, making editing HTML quite cumbersome.

I saw a previous issue about this (#958), where extensions were discussed. I've never installed an extension and don't even know how to view whether I have extensions installed or not, which is another reason I deleted, re-downloaded, and installed Visual Studio Code from scratch just to be sure.

Whenever the console updates, he loses his output window.

data.title: Scroll wheel click doesn't close working files
data.body:
Upon clicking open files using the scroll wheel, instead of closing, a scroll symbol appears. 

This is the expected behaviour in Chrome:
![chrome](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1297882/13435641/900f3f56-dfdb-11e5-80bc-a83fc1a2d7f8.gif)

This is the resulting behaviour in VSCode:
![working_files](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1297882/13435699/d718cc96-dfdb-11e5-888c-9322a309da81.gif)

This works in VSCode on OS X.

data.title: Create rpm package
data.body: Related #1056

data.title: languages.filenamePatterns is ignored
Empty extension - ghost logging
data.body:
This is strange to me. I created an [extension](https://github.com/waderyan/vscode-babelrc) for adding json validation to babelrc files. I removed everything that was unnecessary including any .js file. 

When I debug my extension, the default console.log seems to run. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449568/13434112/03e1941c-dfd5-11e5-8663-ae685302ca77.png)

See the log "Spell and Grammar checker active...". This is the same log from [spell and grammar check extension](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-spell-check/blob/master/extension.ts). 

I don't know if this is causing problems... but its strange behavior to me. Why is this happening?

data.title: Provide a command to restart VS Code

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: I would have naturally expected there to be a "restart" command for Visual Studio Code, out of the box. Any chance of adding this in? The current command name is "reload window," which is probably technically precise, but on the other hand, isn't really user-friendly. Could we add an alias for "restart Visual Studio Code" (or similar) for the "reload window" function? Cheers, Trevor Sullivan Microsoft MVP: PowerShell

data.title: Show a link button in error notifications
data.body:
This feature request covers the frontend UI for issue #3448.

I've added a 'url' and 'urlLabel' attribute to the error message returned from debug adapters.
The latest node-debug returns a url and label for all relative paths.

data.title: Polish Indentation story
data.body:
Changes to how the editor handles indentation:
- Provide the editor with the auto detected indentation #3259 
- Given the previous item, we can remove the editor input to indentation type map cache

Changes to the indentation status bar contribution:
- _Change Tab Size for Current File_ action should be called: _Change Indentation Size_
- We should hide the action when the model has tabs, simply because it doesnt seem to be a use case that a user would like to change the tab indentation size for a single file. Its usually a setting.
- Move the action to the third position of the actions list, instead of the first
- Change _Configured Tab Size_ to _Current Indentation Size_
